author: _drinkcoffee
content:
> It would be difficult to identify which contracts were written in Solidity vs not.
<@!301186049323958275> There is auxdata / metadata which indicates the compiler and version. Unfortunately, there isn't a large proportion of contracts with this information in them.
All Solidity contracts start by setting up a "Free Memory Pointer". This is a location that contains the memory offset where the code can allocate memory variables from. As such, all Solidity contracts start with: 6080604052

author: sky.cactus
content: I suppose you could use that to get a ballpark number.  However, anyone can start a contract with that, written in Solidity or not.
